class.title: Class Definition
class.description: A Solidity “contract” definition (potentially any bit of code that can be deployed)

class_name.title: Class Name
class_name.description: A class (contract) name used during compilation.

class_header.title: Class Header
class_header.description: Class name + the ABI for the class.

object_name.title: Object Name
object_name.description: The name of an address in an abstract contract system.

context.title: context
context.description: A mapping of system variables to an environment, defined as a union of one or more other environments. For example, you might have a 'working environment' or an environment with no blockchain, but a context is associated with a specific blockchain and a specific set of contracts.

link.title: LINK(objectname) Macro
link.description:
A preprocessor macro used in Solidity code.
It is populated with a unique dummy address by the dapple preprocessor.  You can think of using LINK as adding a special type of argument to the constructor which can only be called at deploy time (by a key and not an address).

class_template.title: Class Template
class_template.description: Any class definition that has a LINK macro.

class_template_header.title: Class Template Header
class_template_header.description: A class header + metadata about LINKs (set of objectnames)
